intro: Driessenia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered driessenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
